title: Emirates rolls out red carpet for A350 viewing in Colombo
byline: In a stylish showcase of aviation elegance, Emirates Airlines welcomed Sri Lankan media and industry leaders aboard its updated Airbus A350 to offer a taste of the Emirates luxury travel experience.

title: Update: At least 15 dead, dozens injured in Ramboda bus accident
byline: At least fifteen people have died after a Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) bus plunged into a precipice in the Garandiella area of Ramboda on the Nuwara Eliya–Gampola main road this morning (May 11).

title: India and Pakistan accuse each other of ’violations’ after ceasefire deal
byline: India and Pakistan have accused each other of ’’violations’’ hours after the two nations said they had agreed to a ceasefire following days of cross-border military strikes.

title: Govt. taking steps to develop comprehensive, sustainable strategy to prevent road accidents: President
byline: While extending his heartfelt condolences to the families of all those who lost their lives in the devastating accident in Garandiella, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said the government is taking steps to develop a comprehensive and sustainable strategy to prevent such incidents.

title: Special waste management programme for ’Clean Sri Lanka’ during State Vesak Festival
byline: In line with the State Vesak Festival that commenced yesterday (10) in the Nuwara Eliya District, a special waste management initiative has been launched under the ’Clean Sri Lanka’ programme to enhance facilities for devotees and ensure proper waste disposal in the city of Nuwara Eliya.

title: Pope Leo appeals for no more war in first Sunday address
byline: Pope Leo XIV appealed for no more war in a message to world powers during his first Sunday blessing at the Vatican.

title: Sri Lankan President welcomes India-Pakistan ceasefire, calls for lasting peace
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake  has warmly welcomed the recent ceasefire agreement between India and Pakistan, calling it a vital and timely step toward safeguarding lives and fostering regional stability.

title: Two SLAF helicopters ready to airlift bus crash victims
byline: The Ministry of Defence said two helicopters have been readied to airlift critically injured individuals from two separate bus accidents - one that occurred this morning (11) in the Garandiella area and another in Welimada yesterday (10) - to Colombo for further treatment.

title: Govt. to provide Rs. 1 Mn compensation per victim in Kotmale bus tragedy
byline: The Government has decided to pay Rs. 1 million as compensation to the families of each individual who died in the tragic bus accident that occurred in Kotmale earlier today.

title: Inmates granted open visits for Vesak
byline: The Department of Prisons announced that inmates across the country will be granted the opportunity for open visits in celebration of Vesak Poya Day.

title: Update: At least 21 dead, dozens injured in Ramboda bus accident
byline: At least 21 people have died after a Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) bus plunged into a precipice in the Garandiella area of Ramboda on the Nuwara Eliya–Gampola main road this morning (May 11).

title: Actress Semini Iddamalgoda arrested
byline: Popular actress Semini Iddamalgoda has been arrested by the Welikada Police.

title: CEB Chairman Dr. Tilak Siyambalapitiya resigns
byline: Dr. Tilak Siyambalapitiya, Chairman of the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB), has reportedly submitted his resignation letter.

title: CEB chairman has not resigned, only requested leave to go abroad: Energy Ministry
byline: The Media Division of the Ministry of Energy has rejected reports circulating in the media regarding the resignation of CEB Chairman Dr. Tilak Siyambalapitiya.

title: Dr. Shafi, family faced great hardships in regaining honour: Faisz Musthapha PC
byline: Senior Gynecologist Dr. Shafi Shihabdeen and his family had to face immense hardships to regain the lost honour and their place in society due to the racially motivated political witch hunt, Faisz Musthapha PC said.

title: Mandhana ton helps India seal tri-series with World Cup on horizon
byline: India opener Smriti Mandhana scored her 11th ODI century to help guide India to a convincing 97-run win over Sri Lanka in the tri-series final.

title: Former NOCSL Secretary banned for five years
byline: Former Secretary of the National Olympic Committee of Sri Lanka (NOCSL) Maxwell de Silva was handed a five-year ban, sources revealed.

title: Banning liquor, casinos, nightclubs for Vesak third day will seriously impact tourism industry: Stakeholders raise concerns
byline: An arbitrary decision taken by the Cabinet to ban the countrywide sale of liquor, casinos and nightclubs for an extra day in addition to the two regular Vesak Poya holidays will have a serious impact on the tourism sector as well as incur a loss up to Rs.1 billion to the state coffers, said industry stakeholders while raising grave concerns.

title: Care worker recruitment from abroad to end: UK Home Secretary
byline: Care workers will no longer be recruited from overseas as part of a crackdown on visas for lower-skilled workers, the home secretary has told the BBC.

title: Semini Iddamalgoda granted bail
byline: Popular actress Semini Iddamalgoda, who was arrested by the Welikada Police for failing to appear in court over matters related to the non-payment of Employees’ Provident Fund (EPF) contributions while operating a private security company was released on bail.

title: Pope Leo appeals for no more war in first Sunday address
byline: Pope Leo XIV appealed for no more war in a message to world powers during his first Sunday blessing at the Vatican.
